items.title: why not send CONNECT_REQ to periph
TypeError: Cannot read property 'test' of undefined
No effect on customization for homebridge
items.body:
I have just installed homebridge on my rPi and have successful connected home assistant. But now I want to hide some switches, sensors and lamps in the "Home" app on the iPhone. So I am customizing Home Assistant customization configuration with this entry but the switch will not disappear.

```
customize:
  switch.a_switch:
    homebridge_hidden: true
```

How do I get home bridge to react to the changes I have made in home assistant config file?

items.title: Consume files generated by other loaders using data['ts-loader-files']
items.body:
This PR creates a mechanism where by ts-loader can consume files generated by other loaders.
Right now this is meant to support [ts-css-loader](https://github.com/MortenHoustonLudvigsen/ts-css-loader), but it can be used with other loaders, that write to data['ts-loader-files'].

I have not made a test for this PR yet, but I wanted to get the code up here to be reviewed. :-)

See also #512

items.title: fluent-react: LocalizationProvider
Question about amount of cells send per update
items.body: I am writing a client that works with this server, and am wondering why all the positions of all the cells around a player are sent to that player, regardless of whether or not those cells have changed at all. Could anyone elaborate as to why, and if there is any way to optimize and only send changes instead of all the information about each cell?

items.title: Revert "Added WMail"
items.body:
Reverts electron/electron-apps#143.

As stated in #143, WMail no longer exists. It makes no sense to have a dead app on the website.
![](https://i.imgur.com/cHmBk1m.png)

items.title: Look at search options
items.body:
Would be cool to build a nice search / stats interface around the data.

The whole dataset is small enough that we could have a small index in browser memory and call out to the API for full records:

Alternatively, algolia have a nice free community search offering, and [apparently it's really nice](https://twitter.com/haroenv/status/853522587498020864).

We should evaluate the options.

items.title: vue2 router state change router.addRoutes
items.body:
### Version
2.2.0

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/myxingke/vueManage.git](https://github.com/myxingke/vueManage.git)

### Steps to reproduce
**Not landed router Array**
`
[{xxxx}, {xxxx}, {xxxx},{'path': '*'}]
`
**notice {'path':‚Äò*‚Äô}**

**login code**
`
let routes = sessionRoutes(res.data.menu)
for( let [ index, route ] of new Map( routes.map( ( item, i ) => [ i, item ] ) ) ) {
  let key = this.$router.options.routes.length-1
  this.$router.options.routes.splice(key, 0, route)
}
this.$router.addRoutes(routes)
`
**result router Array**
`
[{xxxx}, {xxxx}, {xxxx},{new router},{new router},{'path': '*'}]
`

**What is actually happening?**
**But that's it**
`
[{xxxx}, {xxxx}, {xxxx},{'path': '*'},{new router},{new router}]
`
**notice ,{'path': '*'}**

When I click on the new page, it appears behind {'path': '*'}. This is not the result I want„ÄÇI hope one is one

**I Hope**

It is it          `[{xxxx}, {xxxx}, {xxxx},{new router},{new router},{'path': '*'}]`
Not it         ` [{xxxx}, {xxxx}, {xxxx},{'path': '*'},{new router},{new router}]`

### What is expected?
`
[{xxxx}, {xxxx}, {xxxx},{new router},{new router},{'path': '*'}]
`

### What is actually happening?
**But that's it**
`
[{xxxx}, {xxxx}, {xxxx},{'path': '*'},{new router},{new router}]
`

---
**Not landed router Array**
`
[{xxxx}, {xxxx}, {xxxx},{'path': '*'}]
`
**notice {'path':‚Äò*‚Äô}**

**login code**
`
let routes = sessionRoutes(res.data.menu)
for( let [ index, route ] of new Map( routes.map( ( item, i ) => [ i, item ] ) ) ) {
  let key = this.$router.options.routes.length-1
  this.$router.options.routes.splice(key, 0, route)
}
this.$router.addRoutes(routes)
`
**result router Array**
`
[{xxxx}, {xxxx}, {xxxx},{new router},{new router},{'path': '*'}]
`

**What is actually happening?**
**But that's it**
`
[{xxxx}, {xxxx}, {xxxx},{'path': '*'},{new router},{new router}]
`
**notice ,{'path': '*'}**

When I click on the new page, it appears behind {'path': '*'}. This is not the result I want„ÄÇI hope one is one

**I Hope**

It is it          `[{xxxx}, {xxxx}, {xxxx},{new router},{new router},{'path': '*'}]`
Not it         ` [{xxxx}, {xxxx}, {xxxx},{'path': '*'},{new router},{new router}]`

Or else is the meaning of dynamic routing?

items.title: An in-range update of eslint-config-simenb-base is breaking the build üö®
items.body:
## Version **12.1.3** of [eslint-config-simenb-base](https://github.com/SimenB/eslint-config-simenb) just got published.
Branch Build failing üö®
Dependency eslint-config-simenb-base
Current Version 12.1.2
Type devDependency
This version is **covered** by your **current version range** and after updating it in your project **the build failed**. As eslint-config-simenb-base is ‚Äúonly‚Äù a devDependency of this project it **might not break production or downstream projects**, but ‚Äúonly‚Äù your build or test tools ‚Äì **preventing new deploys or publishes**. I recommend you give this issue a high priority. I‚Äôm sure you can resolve this :muscle: ---
Status Details - ‚ùå **continuous-integration/travis-ci/push** The Travis CI build is in progress [Details](https://travis-ci.org/SimenB/add-asset-html-webpack-plugin/builds/222024683) - ‚ùå **continuous-integration/appveyor/branch** AppVeyor build failed [Details](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/SimenB/add-asset-html-webpack-plugin/build/1.0.292)
Not sure how things should work exactly? There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html) and of course you may always [ask my humans](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new).
--- Your [Greenkeeper](https://greenkeeper.io) Bot :palm_tree:

items.title: Account suspended/blocked error lacks detail; lead to hanging website on refresh
items.body:
[//]: # (Before logging this issue, please post to the Report a Bug guild from the Habitica website's Help menu. Most bugs can be handled quickly there. If a GitHub issue is needed, you will be advised of that by a moderator or staff member -- a player with a dark blue or purple name. It is recommended that you don't create a new issue unless advised to.)

[//]: # (Bugs in the mobile apps can also be reported there.)

[//]: # (If you have a feature request, use "Help > Request a Feature", not GitHub or the Report a Bug guild.)

[//]: # (For more guidelines see https://github.com/HabitRPG/habitrpg/issues/2760)

[//]: # (Fill out relevant information - UUID is found in Settings -> API)
### General Info
  * UUID: 54d0305c-fbc0-4fe8-a941-948204625f08
  * Browser: Firefox 52.0.2
  * OS: Windows 10

### Description
[//]: # (Describe bug in detail here. Include screenshots if helpful.)

When a user is logged in and they become blocked (i.e. the "auth.blocked" property becomes set to "true"), a refresh of the page causes the website to hang on the loading screen.  Screenshot is below.

Related to this (I think) is a block of code in website/client-old/js/config.js (line 84-87) that never runs due to the response.data object from the server never having a "code" property (legacy?).  I added a console.log statement which you can see in the screenshot (returned response.data object is in the bottom right pane).  As you can see, there is no way to determine that the error is an account suspended error unless you look at the locale-dependent message.


![githubissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5566652/25028779/b5029976-206b-11e7-93c4-cd2a0eac9773.PNG)

I think the easiest/concise/maintainable way to fix this would be to extend the "NotAuthorized" class with an "AccountSuspended" class (website/common/script/libs/errors.js).  Editing the "NotAuthorized" class would be relatively difficult because the constructor only accepts a string, and we probably don't want to mess with the constructor or do weird hacky logic with message.  I think it also makes sense from an abstraction standpoint; an AccountSuspended error is an extension of a NotAuthorized error, and there is already logic in config.js that is supposed to handle the specific case of a suspended account.  I.e. something like:

![githubissue2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5566652/25029073/aebba500-206e-11e7-8aa7-92c5d69add41.PNG)


What do you guys think?
